repository.corpname: Special Collections Research Center, The George Washington University

did.physloc: Materials may be stored off-site, and may require additional retrieval time. Please contact the Special Collections Research Center for more information.
did.abstract: Peter Pelham was the fifth president of Mount Vernon Seminary and Junior College, originally founded in Washington, D.C. in 1875. Mount Vernon Seminary and College merged with The George Washington University in 1999. This collection contains correspondence, and administrative files from the collection of Peter Pelham, president of Mount Vernon Seminary from 1962-1976.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into five series: Correspondence, Development and strategic planning files, Special event files, Administrative files 1975-1977, and Administrative files.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Some material may be copyrighted or restricted. It is the patron's obligation to determine and satisfy copyright or other case restrictions when publishing or otherwise distributing materials found in the collections.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Please cite unpublished materials in the following way:
Please provide the title and date of item, catalog number (if applicable it will be found written on the folder), name of the collection, name of the repository, and location of the repository.

Example: James Oglethorpe to the Trustees, 13 January 1876, RG0001 Series 1, Box 4, Folder 3. Records of the Board of Trustees, Special Collections Research Center, Gelman Library, The George Washington University, Washington, D.C.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: The Mount Vernon Seminary and College archives were acquired by GWU upon merger with Mount Vernon College. The collection was transferred to the Foggy Bottom campus in 2009.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Peter Pelham served as the fifth President of Mount Vernon Seminary and Junior College from 1962-1976.
Pelham graduated from Williams College, received his MA from Harvard University, served in the United States Air Force, and worked for three years as assistant director of admissions at Williams.

During Pelham's presidency, Mount Vernon Seminary was disestablished and the institution's name was officially set as Mount Vernon Junior College. In 1970, the Florence Hollis Hand Chapel was dedicated. Mount Vernon College receives initial accreditation as a four-year college during Pelham's turn.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection contains files produced during the time Peter Pelham served as President of Mount Vernon Seminary and Junior College, including personal correspondence, logistical information about special events, and files produced by various strategic planning committees. The materials range in date from 1962 to 1982.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains correspondence to and from Peter Pelham. The materials in this series date from 1962-1977.

did.unittitle: Faculty and staff memos and correspondence
Foxhall Road--Peter Pelham interview and correspondence, invitation

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The materials in this series contain files concerning the long range plann for and development of Mount Vernon Seminary and Junior College, including files on building, Middle States, curriculum, etc. The materials date from 1964-1977.

did.unittitle: Final report--the ad hoc committee for the evaluation of new programs
Long range planning conversations with Dean Meder, April 19
Mount Vernon Seminary and Junior College long range planning
MVC Board of Directors--meetings of May 28 meeting
NEH grand proposal for arts and humanities expansion

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The materials of this series are files concerning speical events held on campus at Mount Vernon, including concerts and assemblies. News concerning Peter Pelham and speeches he gave are also included in this series. The materials date from 1966-1977.

did.unittitle: Chrissie McCutchen Award Character Excellence Cup
Peter Pelham newspaper articles and clippings
Tradition and Change: The Crucial Years--speech

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: It appears that the box containing these files was transferred separately and Special Collections chose to retain the original order and make this material a separate series.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains administrative files dating from 1975-1977. They are concerning a wide range of topics including but not limited to admissions, alumnae affairs, annual fund, finance, public relations, and student affairs.

did.unittitle: Washington Institute for Women in Politics
Washington Institute for Women in Politics #2

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The materials in this series include administrative files from the office of Peter Pelham, including press clippings, financial materials, and meeting minutes from various committees. The materials range in date from 1969-1982.

did.unittitle: Ad hoc committee on student life
Vice President and Dean's bi-weekly meetings
Washington Star and Washington Magazine ads
